channel.title: Drive Safe in the Snow
channel.description:
As you may know, I live near Detroit. So I know how bad roads can be, especially in the winter. Hell, I experienced this firsthand last year when a car cut me off on a snowy day and I spun out across the entire interstate highway. Luckily, I was entirely unharmed, but that's just luck. Let this story from my area be a good reminder to drive safe whenever the road is snowy or icy.
https://www.detroitnews.com/story/news/local/wayne-county/2019/01/22/trenton-car-train-crash-two-dead/38937613/

item.title: Drive Safe in the Snow
item.dc:creator: Twil1ight
item.description:
Another reason on the list why I shouldn’t get my own car. /s

On serious note, I’m not entirely sure how it look like in winter but I can imagine how dreadful it might be. It’s best to get the hawk’s eyes before any ride.

Read full topic

item.title: Drive Safe in the Snow
item.dc:creator: PoisonedSquid
item.description:
I agree with this. If you need to go somewhere, but the roads are extremely icy, DO NOT DRIVE ON THEM or at the very least, be extremely careful. Also, thank goodness you’re okay, Orange
